id: 7 fantasy football waiver wire pick-ups who could help you win in the playoffs7 fantasy football waiver wire pick-ups who could help you win in the playoffs7 fantasy football waiver wire pick-ups who could help you win in the playoffs

		By: Charles Curtis		| November 6, 2018 2:07 pm		


		Follow @bycharlescurtis	
!function(d,s,id){var js,fjs=d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0],p=/^http:/.test(d.location)?'http':'https';if(!d.getElementById(id)){js=d.createElement(s);js.id=id;js.src=p+'://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js';fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js,fjs);}}(document, 'script', 'twitter-wjs');


We’re entering the home stretch of sorts in fantasy football: If you’re in a league with playoffs starting in Week 14, the postseason is looming.For those of you with contending teams, you’ve got to think ahead — yes, there are still bye weeks to consider. But if you have a deep bench, you can free up a spot to speculate on a player who might help you in the fantasy playoffs and get to a name long before other teams do.Let’s run through a few players to speculatively grab now:This is particularly for contending Todd Gurley owners: He’s your insurance policy if Gurley sits with an injury or if the Rams end up sitting their prized star a bit later in the season if they clinch the top seed in the NFC. Plus, for dynasty leaguers, he’s talented! Look at this crazy touchdown he scored last week:If you own Kareem Hunt, of course. But even if you’re not contending, now’s the time to grab handcuffs like this one.Aaron Doster-USA TODAY SportsIt’s possible he’s on your waiver wire after getting benched and replaced by Ryan Fitzpatrick. But we’ve seen the coaching staff in Tampa change its mind before, and if the Bucs aren’t contending by December, maybe they give Winston a chance again to prove he’s not a bust. His future matchups include games against the 49ers, Panthers and Saints. If you have room on your bench and you’re streaming quarterbacks this year, he might help.ESPN reported his return from a torn ACL is a “longshot.” But you know the tight end position is terrible this year, so why not take a chance and stash a player who caught eight touchdowns two years ago?I’ve been touting him all season as a stash, and I’ll still do it now — despite two back-to-back big games for Lamar Miller, he just put up a dud against the Broncos. What if Foreman returns from injury and shows explosiveness out of the backfield? It’s worth a shot.The rookie could be Antonio Brown insurance.Kim Klement-USA TODAY SportsHe was starting to work his way into the offense before a hamstring injury sidelined him. Maybe if Peyton Barber continues to disappoint, the second-rounder is given more of a role when he returns to full health. Fantasy, Fantasy Football, NFL, Fantasy, NFL
		Charles is a writer for For The Win. He once dropped an easy foul ball at Shea Stadium and was booed by 35,000 angry Mets fans (and hasn't recovered from it).
